title: Napoli star Dries Mertens reveals 75-year-old lady gives him a slap when he doesn't play well
text:
Napoli star Dries Mertens has revealed that a 75-year-old lady who lives above him will give him a slap if he doesn't play well.

Mertens has been playing for Napoli since 2013 and described football in Italy as 'a wonderful sickness', with people of all ages enchanted by it.

'Football in Italy is like a wonderful sickness, because people are infected with this love for the sport from childhood to old age,' Mertens told the Serie A channel (via Football Italia).

Napoli's Dries Mertens revealed that a 75-year-old lady slaps him if he doesn't play well

'There's a lady who lives above me, I think she's 75 years old, and every morning she says to me: 'You played well, good boy.' Or if I played badly, she'll give me a slap and say I could've done better. That doesn't happen in Belgium!'.

Thankfully for Mertens, he usually performs well and so far this season he has mustered five goals in seven games across all competitions.

Mertens, a Napoli player since 2013, described football in Italy as 'a wonderful sickness'

Mertens' only trophies with Napoli so far remain the Coppa Italia and Supercoppa Italiana from 2014, but individually he has often performed impressively.

In total, the forward has made 289 appearances for Napoli, scoring 114 goals and providing 68 assists.

There have been suggestions that Mertens' association with Napoli could come to an end when his contract expires next summer.

Napoli, who are currently fourth in Serie A, face Torino away on Saturday evening.
description: Napoli star Dries Mertens has revealed that a 75-year-old lady who lives above him will give him a slap if he doesn't play well.
